pr_title: [CALCITE-4393] ExceptionInInitializerError due to NPE in SqlCallBinding caused by circular dependency

timeline.bodyText:
Suggest you don’t create the defaultCall outside the loop. Most calls do not need default arguments.
You could in-line the defaultCall method, because it’s very simple.
timeline.author: julianhyde

replies.bodyText: Thanks, I was not aware that most case indeed did not require the default call. Changed.
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: static? The motivation is to ensure the method does not accidentally use the fields.
timeline.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: method removed in the latest version
replies.author: rubenada

timeline.bodyText: Should this be moved outside of the loop?
timeline.author: vlsi

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to create a new call, if one already exists?
timeline.author: liyafan82

replies.bodyText: having a single static call caused a circular dependency, the purpose is to avoid it (by creating the default call ad-hoc only when needed)
replies.author: rubenada

replies.bodyText: Just in case, a nested static class would avoid circular dependency as well.
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText:
Yes... but my fear is that it would be a more "obscure" solution when looking at this code in the future: "why is this static nested class here, for apparently no reason, just with a private static field...".
I guess it can be a good (and efficient) solution, but we'll need a clear javadoc stating the purpose of the class and why it is needed (and cannot be removed). It should be feasible, I'll commit this approach.
replies.author: rubenada
